intro: Pimpinella polygama, commonly known as the many-seeded cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to regions of southern and eastern Asia, including China, Japan, and the Himalayas. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its fruits are schizocarps, splitting into two one-seeded parts when mature. Pimpinella polygama is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and mountainous areas.
